title: CUstom Item Sets
body:
I know it was removed in the last UI Update, However I would like to know if there is any way to change item sets?

Thanks guys.

replies.body:
While it's far from optimal, you can still run the old client (instructions below), which still has access to the old item set builder that we're all accustomed to. You'd think that at the very least, they'd let you have access to the old builder from the new client while they work their magic.

 -- The following instructions work for Windows 7 --
TO RUN THE OLD CLIENT: 
 1) When you're on the login screen of the new client press "Launch Legacy Client" at the bottom right of the screen, directly under the login boxes. 

TO ALWAYS RUN THE OLD CLIENT:
 1) Navigate to your original install directory. If you can't remember, open up your start menu > search for "League of Legends" > right click on League of Legends > click "properties" > the "target" or filepath should be displayed.
 2) Either click a drag the "lol.launcher" file to your desktop to create a new shortcut, or right click "lol.launcher" > click "Create Shortcut" > create a shortcut to the original launcher wherever!

IF YOUR NEW CLIENT IS BUGGY AND DOESN'T LET YOU DO THIS:
 -- First try the instructions at this link: 
http://boards.euw.leagueoflegends.com/fr/c/bug-reports-eu/ZEVZVZVN-solution-to-use-your-old-client-without-reinstall

-- If this doesn't work, try reinstalling League of Legends altogether. (Go to leagueoflegends.com and re-download the installer).
(Feel free to uninstall the old one!)

I would **_REALLY LOVE_** to see the old item set creator put back into the game - I use it for theory crafting quite often. (Especially as a support main who plays champs that aren't always played as a support! Like Lux! RITO PLZ   {{item:3151}} )

Right now you can still go to the legacy client to use them, and your custom sets will still be there when you load up a game using the new stuff.

Just a reminder of course.
You have to load into a game on the legacy client for the changes to take effect. So just load into a custom then leave it and it should be good.
